timeline.message:
More cleanups:
 - make constructor of HashParameters protected, add factory methods
 - minimize changes (i.e remove changes that are not critical and directly related to this PR)
 - change the static get() methods to create()
fix a javadoc error and a spotbugs error

More cleanups:
 - make constructor of HashParameters protected, add factory methods
 - minimize changes (i.e remove changes that are not critical and directly related to this PR)
 - change the static get() methods to create()

More cleanups:
 - make constructor of HashParameters protected, add factory methods
 - minimize changes (i.e remove changes that are not critical and directly related to this PR)
 - change the static get() methods to create()

timeline.bodyText:
These exception check can be done more elegantly by
assertThrows(ExecutionException.class, () -> readJsonArray("{ \"p\" : \"val\" }"));
timeline.author: Verdent

replies.bodyText: I've made the change, but note that means giving up on checking the exception cause.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

timeline.bodyText: I think this is some leftover which can be removed.
timeline.author: Verdent

replies.bodyText: This class extends HashParameters, since I've refactored it out of the webserver package, it only shows as import for this change.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

timeline.bodyText: Should not be io.helidon.common.http.ContextualRegistry an import instead of having it written like this?
timeline.author: Verdent

replies.bodyText: This is the only way to avoid deprecated compiler warning.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

replies.bodyText: We need to remove ContextualRegistry before 2.0 is released anyway, so no problem
replies.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: The All rights reserved. should be removed. Not sure why the copyright plugin ignores this
timeline.author: tomas-langer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@
 /*
- * Copyright (c) 2018, 2019 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
+ * Copyright (c) 2018, 2020 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

replies.bodyText: I've only updated the year in these copyright changes, can we do that change in a separate PR ?
replies.author: romain-grecourt

replies.bodyText: Marking this as resolved since I think we should solve this issue for all of Helidon not just for this PR.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

timeline.bodyText: This seems to be just reformatted. Please do not reformat existing code unless necessary or an issue - e.g. the line 73 is OK, lines 69-70 not.
timeline.author: tomas-langer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -66,22 +66,43 @@
     private final Class<?> rawType;
 
     /**
-     * Constructs a new generic type, using the provided generic type information and
-     * deriving the class.
+     * Constructs a new generic type, using the provided generic type
+     * information and deriving the class.
      *
      * @param genericType the generic type
-     * @param <N>         generic type of the returned GenericType
+     * @param <N> generic type of the returned GenericType
      * @return new type wrapping the provided type

replies.bodyText: Roger that, I've tried to avoid these as much as possible ; but sometimes I can't help it :p
replies.author: romain-grecourt

timeline.bodyText: The line breaks were intentional. Do not reformat code...
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: The javadoc is wrong. You cannot return "this instance" as this is a static method
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: javadoc for return is not correct
timeline.author: tomas-langer

To negate another {@code CharMatcher}, use {@link #negate()}. + *

timeline.bodyText: javadoc for return is not correct (please fix for all methods)
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: As this is a backward incompatible version - should we keep Content in and remove it in 3.0, or just remove it immediately?
timeline.author: tomas-langer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,7 +40,9 @@
  * It is possible to register function to convert publisher to {@link CompletionStage} of a single entity using
  * {@link #registerReader(Class, Reader)} or {@link #registerReader(Predicate, Reader)} methods. It
  * is then possible to use {@link #as(Class)} method to obtain such entity.
+ * @deprecated use {@code io.helidon.media.common.MessageBodyReadableContent} instead
  */
+@Deprecated

replies.bodyText: That's a very good question. I did the work initially for 1.x, now that we are at 2.x we should rethink this. Let's track this item in a separate issue.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

replies.bodyText:
E.g., I'd like to remove the old Reader / Writer  interfaces with all the corresponding registerReader / registerWriter method and instead use the new .context() methods.
The .content() method remains, so that keeps some kind of compatibility, also I'm positive that there is not much code declaring variables of type Content ; so we should feel OK in removing the Content interface.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

timeline.bodyText: As this is now a public class, an explanation of what concatenation means in this context would be good. I have no idea.
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: Our APIs should neither expect nor return null. Please refactor the method and usage to only invoke if not null
timeline.author: tomas-langer

replies.bodyText: I've moved that method from an existing place, I take the blame since I'm making it "public" ; will make the change.
replies.author: romain-grecourt

timeline.author: tomas-langer
